name: Free Online AASA / iOS Universal Links Validator - ATools
description: Validate Apple App Site Association (AASA): check reachability, Content-Type, JSON structure and applinks rules; includes a Universal Links matcher and a troubleshooting guide.
seoDescription: Free online AASA / iOS Universal Links validator: check HTTPS reachability and Content-Type for .well-known/apple-app-site-association (or root path), parse and validate AASA JSON structure (applinks.apps, details.appID, paths/components), and test whether a Universal Link URL matches your AASA rules. Includes a practical setup and troubleshooting guide for common Universal Links failures.

ui.title: AASA / iOS Universal Links Validator
ui.description: Note: Browsers are restricted by CORS, so this tool fetches AASA via a public proxy. Do not input sensitive internal addresses; AASA should be publicly accessible.
ui.invalidDomainInput: Please enter a valid domain or site URL.
ui.matchOk: Matched: this URL should be treated as a Universal Link (rule-level)
ui.matchBad: Not matched: this URL does not hit any AASA rules (rule-level)
ui.matchNeedAasa: Fetch/select a valid AASA first (and ensure it can be parsed).
ui.matchInvalidUrl: Please enter a valid Universal Link URL.
ui.matchNote: Note: this is rule-level matching only; real iOS behavior is affected by caching, install state, OS version, and entry points.

tutorialBlocks.title: 1) Deploy AASA (server)
items: No extension (no `.json`), HTTPS accessible, and return 200.
`Content-Type: application/json` is recommended (signed AASA may be `application/pkcs7-mime`).

tutorialBlocks.title: 2) Configure iOS (client)
items: In Xcode > Associated Domains, add `applinks:your-domain.com` (include subdomains as needed).
Make sure `appID` is correct: `<TeamID>.<BundleID>` and matches your signing.
Install the app and test by tapping links from Safari/Notes/Messages.

tutorialBlocks.title: 3) Common failure causes
items: Invalid AASA JSON: missing `applinks.details[].appID` or missing `paths/components`.
iOS caching: updates may take time to take effect.
Apple CDN may cache: `app-site-association.cdn-apple.com` may not be real-time.

tutorialBlocks.title: 4) Local quick checks (optional)
tutorialBlocks.note: Note: commands may vary across macOS/iOS versions; enterprise networks/proxies may affect fetching.

ui.issueProxyNoStatus: Proxy did not return a status field.
ui.issueFinalUrlEndsWithJson: Final URL ends with .json: Apple requires a filename without extension (apple-app-site-association).
ui.issueNoContentType: Content-Type is missing (proxy limitation or origin did not send it).
ui.issueContentTypeSigned: Content-Type is application/pkcs7-mime (signed AASA): browsers cannot parse it directly; inspect locally with openssl.
ui.issueContentTypeNotJsonTpl: Content-Type does not look like application/json: {contentType}
ui.issueBodyLooksLikeHtml: Response looks like HTML (may be a 404 page, redirect page, or auth/WAF page).
ui.issueAasaTopLevelMustBeObject: AASA top-level must be a JSON object.
ui.issueApplinksMissing: Missing applinks: if you only use WebCredentials/Activity Continuation this may be expected.
ui.issueApplinksAppsShouldBeEmpty: applinks.apps is usually an empty array [] (legacy values may cause compatibility issues).
ui.issueApplinksDetailsEmpty: applinks.details is empty: no appID/paths rules can match.
ui.issueDetailsAppIdMissingTpl: applinks.details[{index}].appID is missing or not a string.
ui.issueDetailsNoPathsOrComponentsTpl: applinks.details[{index}] has no paths/components; it may not match any URL.
ui.issueUniversalLinkMustBeHttps: Universal Links must be https:// URLs.
ui.issueNoMatchingAppId: No matching appID found in this AASA.
ui.issueHostMismatchTpl: URL host ({urlHost}) differs from input host ({inputHost}); iOS fetches AASA per-domain.
